metadata.Title: CVE-2017-9403 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
In LibTIFF 4.0.7, a memory leak vulnerability was found in the function TIFFReadDirEntryLong8Array in tif_dirread.c, which allows attackers to cause a denial of service via a crafted file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9403` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtiff-opengl - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.8
libtiff-tools - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.8
libtiff5 - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.8
libtiffxx5 - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.8
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> this will not be fixed in precise/esm

criterions.comment: tiff package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.0.3-7ubuntu0.8').
